title: Sure, here's a curated reading list of 20 articles up to 2023 on complex reasoning using pre-trained language models (PLMs
note: with a focus on knowledge-augmented methods, few-shot prompting, neuro-symbolic methods, and rationale-based methods:

title: **"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** - Petroni et al
Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training"** - Guu et al
**"K-Adapter: Infusing Knowledge into Pre-Trained Models with Adapters"** - Wang et al
**"Knowledge-Aware Fine-Tuning for Better Handling Unanswerable Questions"** - Zhang et al
**"Augmenting Pre-trained Language Models with Knowledge Graphs for Dialogue Generation"**
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"Few-Shot Text Generation with Pattern-Exploiting Training"**
**"An Empirical Study of GPT-3 for Few-Shot Knowledge-Based Question Answering"**
**"Prompt Programming for Large Language Models: Beyond the Few-Shot Paradigm"**
Disentangling Reasoning from Vision and Language Understanding"**
**"Neural-Symbolic Machines: Learning Semantic Parsers on Freebase with Weak Supervision"**
**"Neural-Symbolic Integration: A Compositional Perspective"** - Garcez et al
Neural-Symbolic Concept Learner"** - Mao et al

container-title: **"Neuro-Symbolic Visual Reasoning: Disentangling 'Visual' from 'Reasoning'"** - Yi et al

title: **"Rationale-Augmented Ensembles in Language Models"** - Rajani et al
Leveraging Language Models for Commonsense Reasoning"** - Bosselut et al
**"Self-Explaining Structures Improve NLP Models"** - Jacovi et al
**"Learning to Explain: Datasets and Models for Identifying Valid Reasoning Chains in Multihop Question-Answering"**
**"Faithful and Plausible Explanations of Medical Code Predictions"**

These articles cover a range of methods and approaches for enhancing the reasoning capabilities of pre-trained language models through various techniques. They provide a solid foundation for understanding the current state of research in this area
